alert.note: Alert for Buffalo; Trempealeau (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued April 20 at 8:56PM CDT until April 24 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...The Flood Watch continues for the following rivers in Wisconsin... Trempealeau River at Dodge affecting Buffalo and Trempealeau Counties. .Recent snowmelt and rainfall has led to rising river levels around the region. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY EVENING TO MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Trempealeau River at Dodge. * WHEN...From Saturday evening to Monday evening. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, The railroad bridge about three quarters of a mile upstream from the gage can restrict the flow. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:45 PM CDT Thursday the stage was 8.5 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached late Saturday evening. - Flood stage is 10.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Additional river and weather information is available at www.weather.gov/lacrosse. The next statement will be issued early Friday morning.
